review_blob: Booze. Serious bourbon. Sour notes and booze. Not as roasty as one might expect and way more bourbon than youd think. Decent yet a sipper. More than i expected but maybe too much. The palate isnt big enough for the bourbon. It tends to over power rather than compliment.

Okay. So this is one of the beers on my bucket list. I know there are better beers out there to find but this brewery turned me on to craft beer many years ago. This is their flagship beer, and very hard to get where I live. Good, but maybe overhyped. Not so much an IPA. Boozie and sweet, with a hint of bitterness to balance. Thick, syrupy. Definitely a sipper. Interesting enough to keep me going. More of a gonzo beer gimmick, than a heartfelt favorite. Worth a try at least once.
Clean. Crisp. Nice floral, sweet aroma. A standard for a traditional ipa. Not overly complex, but wonderfully composed. So many try, few achieve. A well done ipa.
Floral. Fresh hops flavor. Refreshing. Almost sessionable. A truly wonderful summer new mi was quite surprised by this one. Nicely balanced. Quite a bit of flavor for 5.2% brew.
Pint at Dicks last Resort in Chicago. Nice tang. Nice card. Regressing but not too tart. Better than I expected. Enjoyable brew for a summer day playing hookey.

Aroma is a mixture of bread, carmel, and pink grapefruit. Pours dark amber with thin white head. May be a bit too cold. Let it warm to taste. Very clean taste. Slight malty sweetness to start followed by tight bitter finish. Not sure exactly what this beer is trying to be. Very drinkable, almost sessionable in taste. But at 7%, not really a session beer. Nice, clean, drinkable... But nothing stands out.

Floral, citrus aroma. Very nice. Light body but flavorful. Not too bitter given the lighter body. Holds up well. A wonderful session ale. One of the better sessionable brews ive tasted. Worth a try on a hot summer day. May turn out to be one of my go to session beers.

Great aroma. Floral, citrus, hoppy goodness. The taste, however, not what i would call balanced. Not overly bitter, but very hop flavor forward. A sourness, bitter citrus taste. Very little malt backing to bring it to closure. I keep wanting the aroma to match the taste but its not happening here. It becomes better as it warms. Recommend enjoying this one near room temperature. Very fresh hop flavor, just needed a little more junk in the trunk. Still good.

Wonderful. Unexpectedly wonderful. I never know what to expected by these special series brews. But alesmith is always solid so i took a shot. Wonderfully balanced. Floral, and sweet citrus aroma. Smooth sweet start. Nice malt backbone. Then BAM! Bitter piney bite rounds it out. Really good. I am a hop snob and ipas are my beer of choice, especially summer months. This stands up to some of the very best. Nicely done Alesmith. Nicely done...

Very solid aroma.fruity and flowery. Nice clear orange and copper appearance with a nice white head.taste is mild and balanced for a double. Very drinkable and dangerous for a double. Another solid offering from ballast point.one of my favorite brewers.

Pours brown. Unassuming. Wow. Packed with flavor. Much more than the standard Maduro. The coffee adds huge complexity and flavor. Wondsrful sessionable brown ale. One of my favorite browns. Worth the effort to get.
beer_name: Cigar City Cubano-Style Espresso Brown Ale

review_blob: Balanced and potent. Artfully crafted with the right amount of roasted, sweetness, coffee, bitterness. Solid mouthfeel. Aroma is a little under promiunced for the taste, maybe due to being too cold. Wonderful stout. Ranks in the top tier.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Espresso Oak Aged

review_blob: Malty, roasted aroma, with a sense of hop floral scent. Pours a nice brown with a diminishing White head. Smells of caramel, and brown sugar. Starts with roasted malt, moves to a sweet amber malt taste. Finishes with a bitter dry hop finish.  Nice mouth feel for a brown ale. Complex yet simple. Nicely done brown ale.

Spicy aroma. five spice. Anis. Pours a copper brown with a white diminishing head. Taste is surprisingly sour. Slightly maple sweet finish. Crisp. Blend number 8. Bottled on October 31st 2012. Hard to pick out the barrel aging. Maybe due to the age. A decent drinkable strong, but missing something. Maybe balance.
Huge head. Good malty, fruity aroma balance. Hazy copper. Mouthfeel is a little mild. A solid ipa. Not overly hoppy, but sometimes that is ok...

Very hoppy aroma. Pure hops. Decent head. Dark brown.  taste is subltle hops. Nice balance.  very much 
Like a black ipa but smoother. Subtle yet complex. My first by this brewery but a good first impression.

A strong porter. Vanilla is very present but a perfect balance. Not too sweet as some porters are. Nice lacing. Perfect head. Solid mouthfeel.  Substance and balance. This is a great beer. A great brewery.

On tap at World of Beer in Naperville. Found this to be a typical stone ipa. Stone beers have a distinct bitter backbone which causes their beers to taste very similar in my opinion. The bittering hops overwhelm the palate and the brew. A nice beer for a hop head like me. Just lavks a little balance.
On tap at World of Beer Naperville. Bitter bite that got more balanced as it warmed. Pallette wrecker for sure but a nice brew. One of tge better offerings ive tasted from this brewery.
Roasted. Nutty. Chocolate. Bitter. Sweet. Very nice. Wonderfully balanced yet complex. Hard to say ive had a better black ipa. Very nicely done...
beer_name: Firestone Walker Wookey Jack Black Rye IPA

review_blob: Pours hazey orange. Aroma is herbal, peaches,, floral. Taste is massive hop bitterness. Slight malt backbone. Very hop centered. Bitterness lingers. Good but could be a bit more balanced.

Pours dark copper with light tan head. Aroma is piney, dark cherries, fruit cake,. Taste is hoppy bite, followed by slight malty backbone with sour cherries, rasberries. Ends with nice lingering bitterness. A complex and tasted amber/red ale. Would drink this again.

What can i say. Truly world class. Absolutely one of my favorites. The aroma is so wonderfully floral and ctrusy. The hops are very focused on flavor rather than bitterness. Though a significant amount of bite exists. There is a wonderfyl sweetness that stays with every sip. I have trouble finding fault with ant aspect of this fine adult beverage.

Bottled 12/12/12. Pours dark orange with large white head. Aroma is pine, lemons, sweet grapefruit. Taste is hop forward, bitter to start. Tangyness lingers. Bitter bite to finish. Enough sweetness to balance but hops are definitely the star. Body is medium, definitely not water. Nice mouthfeel, appropriate carbonation. Very nicely put together.

Pours light brown with nice off white head. Aroma is faint sweetness, brown sugar, nutty. Taste is sweet, nice and beatufiul hazelnut. Not too strong but defintely oresent. Nice bitterness to balance the sweetness. A very unique and decadent brew. Masterfully done.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series # 4: Frangelic Mountain Brown

review_blob: Pours deep copper with small lacey head. Smells of caramel, pine, and bread notes. Taste is malty bread sweetness in the front, dry slightly roasted bitterness in the end. Finishes herbal and grassy through the nose. A flavorful red ale. Would drink this again.

Pours cloudy copper brown. Off white head. Very carbonated. Aroma is subtle. Banana, bread, cereal, some fruit. Taste is sweet but more bitter than expected. Spicey, malty, fruitcake with a dry bitter finish. Very drinkable for abv.

Oours dark brown. Off white head. Scents of coffee and almonds and root beer. Taste is roasted sweet, nutty. Vanilla. Root beer. Like an old time fountain soda. Smooth but complex. This gets better with every sip. Another fine beverage by Cigar City.
beer_name: Cigar City Bolita Double Nut Brown Ale

review_blob: Pours dark orange, cloudy. Nice off white head. Aroma is citrus and dough. Yeasty. Taste is bitter, very slight sweetness. A little spice. Slight grapefruit. Yeasty finish with a resilient bitterness. Good but not outstanding.

Pours deep copper with a one finger white head. Medium lacing. Aroma is wonderful. Doughy bread. Like an early morning bakery. Taste is rich caramel with a bitter end. Chewy. Spicey lingering aftertaste. Excellent.
beer_name: Ballast Point Tongue Buckler Imperial Red Ale

review_blob: Pours yellow. Cloudy. Hops abound aroma. Some citrus. Taste is a hop monster. Pungent, bitter, floral. Caramel  and nuts. A serious hop head ipa.
Shared with GranvilleTim. Pours orange and slightly cloudy. Very citrusy aroma. Smells like a bag of oranges and grapefruit. Sweet and floral. Hoppy finish. I really like this ipa.
beer_name: Cigar City Jai Alai India Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours black. Aroma is very roasty, coffee. Taste is much the same. Coffee, chocolate. Smooth, medium palate. A little light on the palate for the style. Tastey. Nice brew.
beer_name: Ballast Point Sea Monster Imperial Stout

review_blob: Vintage 2012 - XV. Pours black with little head. Thick and lacey. Wonderfully sweet and pronounced bourbon. Nice little hop bite. Very good twist to a solid russian.

Shared with GranvilleTim. Pours brown. A little cloudy, translucent. Smell is sweet, honey. Taste is very sweet, carmel, maple finish but slight. Little hop balance. Sweet and drinkabke. But not overly complex.

Shared with GranvilleTim. Pours black. Nice little brown head. Good lacing. Intense mesquite aroma. Smells like a good backyard bbq. Tasty is smokey but wonderfully sweet balance. Good roasted undertones. Complex but so well put together. I really enjoyed this one. Better than expected.
beer_name: The Bruery Smoking Wood - Rye Barrel

review_blob: Bomber shared courtesy of GranvilleTim. 2010 vintage. Wow. Impressive. Pourse thick and black. Intensely roasted sweet aroma. Coffee notes. Syrupy mouthfeel. Alcohol completely hidden. Finishes with a balance of slight hoppy bitterness and sweet vanilla. Wonderfully complex yet so easily drnkable. Absolutely yummy.
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Courtesy of GranvilleTim a four year verticle! Starting with 09 to 11. Pours dark brown. Nice lacing. Bourbon smell with coffee aromas, more so as the years progressed. Wonderfully pleasant balance of sweetness, coffee, roasted malt, bourbon undertones. The bourbon is complimentary, not front seat. Flavors are more pronounced in newer years. Older vintages much more mellow and melded. A wonderful treat. Thanks Tim!

Pours light amber/orange. Nice lacing. Spicey citrus aroma. Pungent hops. Taste... Wonderfully balanced. Sweet start with floral spicey hops kick. Perfect palate. Not too thin but not overly thick. Bitterness lingers until the next sips. Truly world class DIPA. On my short list.
Pours like an oil can. Thick black oil. Little brown head. Menacing. Aroma is dark syrup, drown sugar.taste is hoppy sweet. Deep, rich. Hard to believe a brew this big comes from a can. Very nice.

Can - dark brown with white head that fades quickly. Roasted almond aroma. Nicley carbonated. The taste surprised me. Very balanced. More complex than I expected. Roasted barley but sweet. Nearly perfect balance. Nice mouth feel for the style. I liked this more than I thought I would. This is one of the better brown ales I have had. Really solid. I would drink this again in a heartbeat.
Color is amber with a nice white lacey head. Piney, citrus, hoppy aroma. Taste is hoppy with a nice malty balance. More bitter than hop aroma. Finishes dry. Clean. Light to medium body. Quality ipa.
Pours black. White lacey head. Aroma is faint smoke. Taste is smokey bitterness, followed by faint sweetness. Crisp. Easy drinking. Nice but not outstanding.

Pours dark amber. Small white head. Great aroma. Rye, citrus, slightly sweet smell. Rich. Nice balance. Rye and hops bitterness. Sweet carmel malt. Medium body. Doesnt linger long. The significant amount of rye gives another layer of complexity. Will drink this again.
beer_name: Bear Republic Hop Rod Rye Ale

review_blob: Nice. Sweet. Balanced. Nice body. Complex. Great aroma. Nice mouth feel. Chocolate and and roasted malt. A well rounded impy. Lots going on. Spice, anise, booze, some interesting notes that i cant put my finger on. One of the more interesting impys i have tried.
beer_name: Goose Island Big John Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours opaque  black with small lacey brown head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, booze, and a faint tartness, almost like sour cherries. Taste is definitely BCS base, very identifiable. Starts sweet and roasted, finishes with a hoppy kick. Bitterness lingers then fades. Sip, savor, repeat. A well done IS. Nothing flashy, but nothing wrong with that. Highly drinkable given ABV. I am not sure what aging would do for this brew but think I will try with my other bottle. The Goose has the stout down... Recommended.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Pours light orange, hazy. Resilient white head. Hoppy, grassy, lemony aroma. Lots of grapefruit, tangy taste. Floral nose aftertaste. Slight sugary finish, with hops bite. Not overly bitter. Not overly sweet. Nice, drinkable IPA.
beer_name: Port Brewing High Tide  Fresh Hop IPA

review_blob: Pours bark reddish brown, with simple white head. Head slightly lacey. Smells like roasted nuts, carmel, carmelized bananas. Taste is roasted pecans, chocolate, with nice bitterness to follow. Medium, sliky body. Very good.
beer_name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)

review_blob: Pours a crisp ruby amber. Slightly rocky white head. Aroma is banana, malty, yeasty. Smells delicious. Good carbonation. First sip is pronounced bitterness as you would expect. As my taste buds adjust, i pick up more of the malty, smokey characteristics. Medium light body. Finishes crisp, with a lingering slight banana flavor. Other citrus notes as well. More complex than expected. One of the better ESB choices i have tasted. Rivals rural english cask bitters i have tasted. Nice.

Pours black w/ light brown head. Scents of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is deep, dark coffee balanced by a chocolate sweetness.  A bit of anise spice to it. One of the few brews that tastes much like it smells. Rich and complex, yet not overly thick and syrupy (is that a word?) like having your dessert and after dinner coffee in one glorious glass. One of the rare beers that lives up to the hype. Hard to say what would make this much better.
